event.title: ’s plan or that the victims were now

data.event: U.S. Rep. Emanuel Cleaver, who spoke at Monday’s funeral for the brothers and their aunt, Precious Triplett, said he didn’t want to hear any talk of the murders being part of God’s plan or that the victims were now in a better place.
And then he yelled: “This was not supposed to happen!” The bodies of Amir and Gerard, their 21-year-old aunt and her boyfriend, Andre Jones Sr., 33, were found March 16 in a Raytown apartment.
The investigation initially was handled by the Metro Squad but has been turned over to Raytown police, who on Monday made no statement on the case.
The boys’ father found the bodies March 16 when he went to the apartment.
Triplett was remembered Monday as a young mother who worked hard to improve her life and that of her son.
On March 13, he scored 26 points against a team of older players.
Price will do the best he can to grant that request when the Blazers take the court Friday night.
